H0.text: The fungi that break down dead plants are most likely harmed by a loss of native plants in an area when humans move in and plant non‑native grasses, flowers, or trees that choke out the native species.

H1.text: The beetles that eat a variety of grass roots would most likely be harmed by a loss of native plants in an area where humans plant non‑native grasses, flowers, or trees that choke out the native species.

H2.text: The mosquitoes that hide under plant leaves would most likely be harmed by a loss of native plants in an area where humans have introduced non‑native grasses, flowers, or trees that choke out native species.

H3.text: The caterpillars that eat only one type of plant would be most likely harmed by a loss of native plants when humans move into an area and plant non‑native grasses, flowers, or trees that choke out the native species.

A4.text: The threatened monarch butterfly exclusively lays its eggs on milkweed species.

A5.text: When environmental conditions change, generalists are able to adapt, but specialists tend to fall victim to extinction much more easily.
